speaker: Midnight Forge
lines: The hood drinks the light; sparks look like stars swallowed whole.
Steel glows the color of memory under heat.
The quench trough dreams of thunder; the shop holds its breath for the sizzle.
You hear the quench song the apprentice hummed, but slower.
The anvil's face is a mirror for fire.
A shadow stands just where the light gives up and waits to see if you do.
You lift the hammer and feel the shop lift with you.
Midnight asks what you want to make of this.
